title: Introduction to 'treemapify'
text: treemap, tile represents single observation, area tile proportional variable. Let’s start drawing treemap tile representing G-20 country. area tile mapped country’s GDP, tile’s fill colour mapped HDI (Human Development Index). geom_treemap() basic geom purpose.  plot isn’t useful without knowing country represented tile. geom_treemap_text() can used add text label tile. uses ‘ggfittext’ package resize text fits tile. addition standard text formatting aesthetics use geom_text(), like fontface colour, can pass additional options specific ‘ggfittext’. example, can place text centre tile place = "centre", expand fill much tile possible grow = TRUE.  Note several tiles top right corner labels. geom_treemap_text() hide text labels fit tile without shrunk minimum size, default 4 points. can adjusted min.size argument.
code: ggplot(G20, aes(area = gdp_mil_usd, fill = hdi)) +   geom_treemap() ggplot(G20, aes(area = gdp_mil_usd, fill = hdi, label = country)) +   geom_treemap() +   geom_treemap_text(fontface = "italic", colour = "white", place = "centre",                     grow = TRUE)

title: Introduction to 'treemapify'
text: geom_treemap() supports subgrouping tiles within treemap passing subgroup aesthetic. Let’s subgroup countries region, draw border around subgroup geom_treemap_subgroup_border(), label subgroup geom_treemap_subgroup_text(). geom_treemap_subgroup_text() takes arguments text placement resizing geom_treemap_text().  three nested levels subgrouping supported subgroup2 subgroup3 aesthetics. Borders text labels subgroups can drawn geom_treemap_subgroup2_border(), etc. Note ‘ggplot2’ draws plot layers order added. means possible accidentally hide one layer subgroup borders another. Usually, ’s best add border layers order deepest shallowest, .e. geom_treemap_subgroup3_border() geom_treemap_subgroup2_border() geom_treemap_subgroup_border().  demonstrated, assurance resulting plot look good. Like ‘ggplot2’ plot, ‘treemapify’ plots can faceted, scaled, themed, etc.
code: ggplot(G20, aes(area = gdp_mil_usd, fill = hdi, label = country,                 subgroup = region)) +   geom_treemap() +   geom_treemap_subgroup_border() +   geom_treemap_subgroup_text(place = "centre", grow = T, alpha = 0.5, colour =                              "black", fontface = "italic", min.size = 0) +   geom_treemap_text(colour = "white", place = "topleft", reflow = T) ggplot(G20, aes(area = 1, label = country, subgroup = hemisphere,                 subgroup2 = region, subgroup3 = econ_classification)) +   geom_treemap() +   geom_treemap_subgroup3_border(colour = "blue", size = 1) +   geom_treemap_subgroup2_border(colour = "white", size = 3) +   geom_treemap_subgroup_border(colour = "red", size = 5) +   geom_treemap_subgroup_text(     place = "middle",     colour = "red",     alpha = 0.5,     grow = T   ) +   geom_treemap_subgroup2_text(     colour = "white",     alpha = 0.5,     fontface = "italic"   ) +   geom_treemap_subgroup3_text(place = "top", colour = "blue", alpha = 0.5) +   geom_treemap_text(colour = "white", place = "middle", reflow = T)

title: Introduction to 'treemapify'
text: default algorithm laying tiles ‘squarified’ algorithm. tries minimise tiles’ aspect ratios, making sure long flat tall skinny tiles. ‘squarified’ treemaps aesthetically pleasing, downside position tiles within plot area can change dramatically even small changes dataset. makes difficult compare treemaps side--side, create animated treemaps. providing layout = "fixed" option ‘treemapify’ geoms, alternative layout algorithm used always position tiles based order observations data frame. ’s important value layout passed ‘treemapify’ geoms, otherwise different layers plot might share layout.

code: ggplot(G20, aes(area = gdp_mil_usd, fill = hdi, label = country,                 subgroup = region)) +   geom_treemap() +   geom_treemap_subgroup_border() +   geom_treemap_subgroup_text(place = "centre", grow = T, alpha = 0.5, colour =                              "black", fontface = "italic", min.size = 0) +   geom_treemap_text(colour = "white", place = "topleft", reflow = T) ggplot(G20, aes(area = 1, label = country, subgroup = hemisphere,                 subgroup2 = region, subgroup3 = econ_classification)) +   geom_treemap() +   geom_treemap_subgroup3_border(colour = "blue", size = 1) +   geom_treemap_subgroup2_border(colour = "white", size = 3) +   geom_treemap_subgroup_border(colour = "red", size = 5) +   geom_treemap_subgroup_text(place = "middle", colour = "red", alpha = 0.5, grow = T) +   geom_treemap_subgroup2_text(colour = "white", alpha = 0.5, fontface = "italic") +   geom_treemap_subgroup3_text(place = "top", colour = "blue", alpha = 0.5) +   geom_treemap_text(colour = "white", place = "middle", reflow = T) ggplot(G20, aes(area = gdp_mil_usd, fill = region, label = country, subgroup = region)) +   geom_treemap() +   geom_treemap_text(grow = T, reflow = T, colour = "black") +   facet_wrap( ~ hemisphere) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set1") +   theme(legend.position = "bottom") +   labs(     title = "The G-20 major economies by hemisphere",     caption = "The area of each tile represents the country's GDP as a       proportion of all countries in that hemisphere",     fill = "Region"   )

text: default algorithm laying tiles ‘squarified’ algorithm. tries minimise tiles’ aspect ratios, making sure long flat tall skinny tiles. ‘squarified’ treemaps aesthetically pleasing, downside position tiles within plot area can change dramatically even small changes dataset. makes difficult compare treemaps side--side, create animated treemaps. providing layout = "fixed" option treemapify geoms, alternative layout algorithm used always position tiles based order observations data frame. ’s important value layout passed treemapify geoms, otherwise different layers plot might share layout. help layout = "fixed", gganimate package, becomes possible create animated treemaps showing e.g. change time. example animated treemap
code: library(gganimate) library(gapminder)  p <- ggplot(gapminder, aes(     label = country,     area = pop,     subgroup = continent,     fill = lifeExp   )) +   geom_treemap(layout = "fixed") +   geom_treemap_text(layout = "fixed", place = "centre", grow = TRUE, colour = "white") +   geom_treemap_subgroup_text(layout = "fixed", place = "centre") +   geom_treemap_subgroup_border(layout = "fixed") +   transition_time(year) +   ease_aes('linear') +   labs(title = "Year: {frame_time}")  anim_save("man/figures/animated_treemap.gif", animation = animate(   p,   renderer = gifski_renderer( )), nframes = 48)

title: A 'ggplot2' geom to draw a treemap. — geom_treemap
text: geom_treemap() requires area aesthetic. ignore aesthetics relating x y axes (e.g. xmin y), x y axes meaningful treemap. Several standard 'ggplot2' aesthetics supported (see Aesthetics). add text labels tiles, see geom_treemap_text(). optional subgroup aesthetic cause tiles clustered subgroups within treemap. See geom_treemap_subgroup_border() geom_treemap_subgroup_text() draw borders around subgroups label , respectively. three nested levels subgrouping supported, subgroup2 subgroup3 aesthetics respective geom_treemap_subgroup2_border() etc. geoms. Four layout algorithms provided. default 'squarified' algorithm (layout = "squarified"), priority ensuring tiles aesthetically pleasing aspect ratio; , narrow short. algorithm, tile placement proceeds one corner, placing tiles either rows columns tiles placed. See Bruls et al. (1999) full algorithm. two variants 'squarified' algorithm. 'scol' forces tile placement begin column, regardless effect aspect ratio; 'srow' forces tile placement row. also apply subgroups. first row column, remaining tiles placed optimise aspect ratios, default algorithm. 'fixed' layout algorithm (layout = "fixed"), plot area divided vertical columns, filled  equal number tiles beginning starting corner. Unlike 'squarified' algorithm, 'fixed' algorithm relative positions tiles fixed order input data frame. can result aesthetically unpleasing layouts, allows side--side comparisons animations created. 'treemapify' geoms added plot value layout start, share common layout.

title: Generate a treemap layout. — treemapify
text: treemapify() returns data frame tile coordinates treemap layout set observations. useful wish draw treemap without help ggplot2 geoms, edge cases creating interactive treemaps 'R Shiny' (see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/q/45021775). easiest way draw treemap 'treemapify' package use provided 'ggplot2' geoms, geom_treemap(). data must tidy data frame, .e. row must represent single observation column single variable. must provide name variable represented area treemap tile area. Optionally, can also select three variables (subgroup, subgroup2 subgroup3) generate layout tiles clustered subgroups nested three levels deep. Four layout algorithms provided. default 'squarified' algorithm (layout = "squarified"), priority ensuring tiles aesthetically pleasing aspect ratio; , narrow short. algorithm, tile placement proceeds one corner, placing tiles either rows columns tiles placed. See Bruls et al. (1999) full algorithm. two variants 'squarified' algorithm. 'scol' forces tile placement begin column, regardless effect aspect ratio; 'srow' forces tile placement row. also apply subgroups. first row column, remaining tiles placed optimise aspect ratios, default algorithm. 'fixed' layout algorithm (layout = "fixed"), plot area divided vertical columns, filled  equal number tiles beginning starting corner. Unlike 'squarified' algorithm, 'fixed' algorithm relative positions tiles fixed order input data frame. can result aesthetically unpleasing layouts, allows side--side comparisons animations created. treemapify_fixed alias treemapify(layout = "fixed").

title: Generate a treemap layout. — treemapify
code: treemapify(   data,   area,   subgroup,   subgroup2,   subgroup3,   layout = "squarified",   start = "bottomleft",   fill = NULL,   label = NULL,   group = NULL,   fixed = NULL,   xlim = c(0, 1),   ylim = c(0, 1) )  treemapify_fixed(...)

title: Generate a treemap layout. — treemapify
text: data tidy data frame. area Name variable (column data) mapped area treemap tiles. subgroup, subgroup2, subgroup3 Optionally, names variables (columns data) tiles grouped, three nested levels. layout layout algorithm, one either 'squarified' (default), 'scol', 'srow' 'fixed'. See Details full details different layout algorithms. start corner start placing tiles. One 'bottomleft' (default), 'topleft', 'topright' 'bottomright'. label, fill Deprecated. removed later versions. group Deprecated. Use subgroup instead. removed later versions. fixed Deprecated. Use layout = "fixed" instead. removed later versions. xlim, ylim boundaries treemap x y dimensions. Must numeric vector length two; default c(0, 1). ... Additional arguments passed treemapify().
